title: 汉钟精机跌1.54%，成交额2.76亿元，近3日主力净流入-4406.75万|汉钟精机_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
8月14日， 汉钟精机 跌1.54%，成交额2.76亿元，换手率2.83%，总市值95.82亿元。
异动分析
空气能热泵+光伏概念+冷链物流+雄安新区+工业互联网
1、2024年7月1日互动易，公司空气源热泵及高温热泵产品，可用于民用集中供暖领域、工业燃煤锅炉改造以及热泵烘干等领域，主要客户为下游主机厂家及供热公司等。
2、2020年9月7日互动平台回复：目前公司真空产品营收大部分来自光伏领域。
3、公司是国内唯一专注于螺杆式压缩机生产销售的企业，目前公司产品主要包括制冷压缩机、空气压缩机、冷藏冷冻压缩机三类。 营业收入中，制冷压缩机占70%，空气压缩机占21%，制冷压缩机的下游主要是大型建筑的中央空调，空气压缩机的应用范围较广，石化、轻纺、采矿冶金等行业都需要空压机，冷冻冷藏机主要用在食品保鲜及工业冷冻。 公司拥有从90kW-1465kW机型最完整螺杆式压缩机产品，主要产品螺杆式制冷压缩机在中国大陆市场占有率第一位。
4、雄县拥有华北地区地质条件最好的中低温 地热田，地热开发全国领先，目前地热供暖覆盖县城供热面积的92%，并形成了可推广、可复制的地热开发“雄县模式”。公司螺杆压缩机已供货国内主流地源热泵 （地热开发关键设备）企业。
5、汉钟精机与树根互联签署战略合作协议，通过此次合作，双方将基于各自优势，共同打造流体机电产业工业互联网智能服务平台：树根互联运用“根云”平台的物联网连接和大数据计算能力，实现对海量设备的快速接入、数据抓取和应用能力；汉钟精机则发挥流体机电产业的智能制造专业优势，两者将共同开展互联网创新，探索设备物联，设备运行监控，售后服务管理，经销商管理等智能化服务。
(免责声明：分析内容来源于互联网，不构成投资建议，请投资者根据不同行情独立判断)
资金分析
今日主力净流入-1024.93万，占比0.04%，行业排名137/243，连续3日被主力资金减仓；所属行业主力净流入-37.52亿，当前无连续增减仓现象，主力趋势不明显。
区间 今日 近3日 近5日 近10日 近20日 主力净流入 -1024.93万 -4406.75万 1738.59万 561.13万 -5736.86万
主力持仓
主力没有控盘，筹码分布非常分散，主力成交额1.32亿，占总成交额的7.67%。
技术面：筹码平均交易成本为18.12元
该股筹码平均交易成本为18.12元，近期该股获筹码青睐，且集中度渐增；目前股价靠近压力位18.11，谨防压力位处回调，若突破压力位则可能会开启一波上涨行情。
公司简介
资料显示，上海汉钟精机股份有限公司位于上海市金山区枫泾工业开发区亭枫公路8289号，成立日期1998年1月7日，上市日期2007年8月17日，公司主营业务涉及从事螺杆式压缩机应用技术的研制开发、生产销售及售后服务。主营业务收入构成为：压缩机(组)55.26%，真空产品36.63%，零件及维修7.02%，铸件产品1.08%。
汉钟精机所属申万行业为：机械设备-通用设备-制冷空调设备。所属概念板块包括：热泵概念、价值成长、 太阳能 、氢能源、HJT电池等。
截至3月31日，汉钟精机股东户数3.14万，较上期增加0.78%；人均流通股16999股，较上期减少0.77%。2025年1月-3月，汉钟精机实现营业收入6.06亿元，同比减少19.09%；归母净利润1.18亿元，同比减少19.58%。
分红方面，汉钟精机A股上市后累计派现22.36亿元。近三年，累计派现8.56亿元。
机构持仓方面，截止2025年3月31日，汉钟精机十大流通股东中，香港中央结算有限公司位居第三大流通股东，持股1308.25万股，相比上期减少1363.02万股。南方中证1000ETF（512100）位居第九大流通股东，持股159.42万股，相比上期减少16.92万股。

author: CMS Medios
title: UFC contará con tecnología de Meta para ofrecer nuevas experiencias a fanáticos
text:
Deportes|
UFC contará con tecnología de Meta para ofrecer nuevas experiencias a fanáticos
La empresa líder de artes marciales mixtas anunció una alianza comercial con Meta para ofrecer experiencias únicas a los aficionados
UFC, la principal organización mundial de artes marciales mixtas (MMA), anunció este miércoles una alianza multianual con el gigante tecnológico Meta para "ofrecer una interacción sin precedentes" con sus seguidores.
El acuerdo incluye la integración de tecnología, herramientas y plataformas de Meta (Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp y Threads, principalmente) al entramado de la compañía presidida por Dana White para ofrecer una experiencia innovadora.
Además, se permitirá "usar creativamente las innovadoras gafas con IA de forma atractiva en los eventos de la UFC", añadió la compañía en un único esbozo de cómo se materializará esta alianza en la experiencia de los seguidores.
"Meta cuenta con las mentes más brillantes del sector tecnológico y van a llevar la interacción con los fans al siguiente nivel. Ya hemos empezado a trabajar en algunas innovaciones con Meta en torno a un nuevo sistema de clasificación de luchadores que compartiré próximamente", expresó hoy White en un comunicado.
En ese mismo documento, Mark Zuckerberg, director ejecutivo de Meta y segunda persona más rica del mundo según la Lista Forbes 2025, se declaró "fan de la UFC" y "deseoso" de colaborar "para que se pueda disfrutar de forma novedosa".
UFC utilizará Threads como principal medio de comunicación en redes sociales
Asimismo, UFC informó que desde ahora el logo de la tecnológica con sede en Menlo Park aparecerá en su famosa jaula de estructura octagonal, así como desplegará experiencias audiovisuales interactivas para fans en los alrededores de los recintos deportivos que acojan sus eventos.
LEE: El sombrío cierre de fase regular para Atlas en el Clausura 2025
Esta alianza entre empresas deja también a Threads, la aplicación con la que Zuckerberg pretendía competir con el antiguo Twitter y que ha tenido una limitada aceptación, como "el principal punto de encuentro de la comunidad UFC".
"Presentaremos (en Threads) contenido original exclusivo para fomentar conversaciones en cada evento y ofreciendo un espacio dedicado a que los fans compartan sus perspectivas e interactúen entre sí", concluyó UFC en su comunicado.
UFC produce cuarenta eventos de MMA anualmente en algunos de los recintos más famosos del mundo con transmisiones disponibles en 170 países y alcance de 975 millones de personas.

title: Defying the Odds: BISSNEX’s Journey Through a Bear Market to a Bright Future | Markets | bigspringherald.com
text:
In the decade-plus history of the cryptocurrency industry, this year has been particularly challenging. Factors like wars and interest rate hikes put global capital markets under pressure, and the crypto industry faced its Lehman moment, along with frequent hacker attacks. Amidst this downturn, we still witnessed the smooth progress of Ethereum's merger and the return of the Layer2 wave, demonstrating the vitality and anti-fragility of the crypto industry.
Persistence often leads to hope. In 2022, alongside the crypto industry, BISSNEX maintained a healthy respect for risk without losing control. This approach led to our contrarian growth this year, completing several funding rounds, and establishing an independent ecological fund and educational academy to help propel the industry forward - all valuable achievements in overcoming challenges.
In April, BISSNEX successfully completed its second round of funding, garnering interest from renowned investment institutions Paradigm and NGC Ventures. This support solidified our position and foresight in the crypto industry. With more stable financial backing, BISSNEX laid a solid foundation for future innovations and expansions, significantly aiding our product development plans.
June saw the establishment of the independent ecological fund, BISSNEX Labs, a milestone development. The lab operates globally, focusing on asset management product issuance, media collaboration, and crypto-economic research. It rigorously evaluates potential investment projects from multiple dimensions and focuses on linking the crypto industry supply chain, helping high-value projects in various fields gain support and contribute back to the industry's growth.
Following some regrettable black swan events in the crypto industry, we aimed to make a meaningful impact, particularly for less experienced investors. In September, we began building BISSNEX College, an important initiative to help users better enter the crypto industry.
On this specially designed educational platform, we offer a wealth of course resources, including basics of cryptocurrencies, trading skills, and investment strategies. BISSNEX College, as a robust learning platform, helps many users learn to cope with the crises and challenges of the crypto market. We believe that only through in-depth learning and understanding can investors succeed in a competitive and rapidly changing market.
During dark times, light becomes more noticeable. Amid the turbulent crypto market, BISSNEX withstood external pressures and tests, receiving more offers of collaboration. In December, we welcomed a new wave of investment from Multicoin Capital and Pantera Capital. During the bear market, this achievement brought us exhilarating strength.
The collaboration with these two VCs provides more financial and strategic support for BISSNEX. We will fully utilize this opportunity to invest more time and effort in product development, technology upgrades, and global market expansion. We particularly focus on upgrading our overall security system and more comprehensive risk monitoring to better serve our users.
Time doesn't speak but gives answers, and navigating through cycles is BISSNEX's answer this year. A good crypto trading platform requires a holistic view of technology, team, product, service, and risk resistance. From this perspective, BISSNEX is already one of the leading exchanges in the crypto industry. We remain clear-headed amidst the fog, cautious and focused in a rapidly evolving field, striving to make BISSNEX a beacon of light illuminating the entire crypto industry.

author: James Olley, Senior Writer, ESPN FC
title: Arsenal can't blame technology for West Ham loss
text:
James Olley, Senior Writer, ESPN FC Dec 28, 2023, 07:29 PM ET Close James Olley is a senior soccer writer for ESPN.com. Read his archive here and follow him on Twitter: @JamesOlley . Follow on X Email Print Open Extended Reactions Mikel Arteta rued a lack of technology as Arsenal were embroiled in another VAR controversy during Thursday's 2-0 home defeat to West Ham United , but said his team had plenty of chances to score goals and win.
Tomás Soucek opened the scoring on 13 minutes, but the goal survived a lengthy check as replays suggested the ball may have gone out as Jarrod Bowen pulled it back from the byline to create the chance.
- Stream on ESPN+: LaLiga, Bundesliga, more (U.S.)
With the goal given by on-field referee Michael Oliver, there was insufficient evidence from the available camera angles to conclusively determine whether it had left the pitch, replicating a similar incident which saw Anthony Gordon 's strike in the Gunners 1-0 loss at Newcastle United in September stand amid Arsenal's protests.
Arteta successfully fought a Football Association charge following comments he made in the aftermath of Gordon's goal and the Gunners boss struck a more conciliatory tone after his side missed out on a chance to go top of the Premier League as Konstantinos Mavropanos sealed West Ham's victory with a 55th-minute header.
"I haven't seen it, [but] they're saying it's not conclusive," said Arteta. "It's a shame that with the technology that we have, that it's not that clear so that we can say whether it's out or in. It's done. It's gone. There's nothing we can do about it now.
"If the technology we have at the moment is not good enough to give us that answer, what we have to do is without that win the game. With the number of situations we generated in the game, that should have been more than enough."
Arsenal had 30 shots and ended with an Expected Goals figure of 2.68 after registering 77 touches in West Ham's box -- a record for a team failing to score in a Premier League game since Opta records began in 2008.
"It is what it is," added Arteta. "We have to try to generate. If we don't score with 30 shots, then we have to do 50 or 60 to try to score. That's the only thing. I can't imagine a game where we have more touches in the box, more dominance and less situations for the opponent against a really good West Ham side. Today though, it wasn't enough to win the game."
Meanwhile, West Ham boss David Moyes celebrated his first league win away at Arsenal, Chelsea , Liverpool or Manchester United in 73 attempts by hinting he could soon hold discussions over a new contract.
Moyes, whose existing deal expires at the end of the season, said: "We are getting ready to talk. I don't think any of us are getting it done too quickly. I don't see any problems with that."

author: Ana Zirojevic
title: Ripple v. SEC end of 2023 case update
text: Since the beginning of 2023, Ripple has made massive progress in its court battle against the United States Securities and Exchange Commission ( [SEC](https://finbold.com/topic/sec/)), which has accused the blockchain company of illegally selling the XRP token, a [cryptocurrency](https://finbold.com/cryptocurrencies/) considered a security by the regulator. Specifically, [at the year’s turn](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-court-case-update-as-of-january-2-2023/), the XRP community was on the fence about the lawsuit’s future, with a poll shared by attorney John Deaton showing that 59.2% believed a settlement would happen, while 40.8% expected a verdict after the court [granted a motion](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-crypto-vc-firm-paradigm-granted-motion-to-join-case/) for crypto [investment](https://finbold.com/guides/investing/) firm Paradigm to join the case. Intense disputes mark start of 2023 Shortly after, the [regulator](https://finbold.com/category/regulations-news/) filed a motion to block Ripple’s expert testimony, [arguing](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-court-case-update-as-of-january-16-2023/) that the experts were unreliable and lacked the right background. In turn, Ripple filed a redacted motion to remove the SEC expert testimony and the accompanying exhibits on the public docket. As the year went on, the case [turned its focus](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-motion-filed-to-amend-request-to-access-hinman-speech-citing-error/) again to the controversial [Hinman speech documents](https://finbold.com/ripple-secures-another-win-as-judge-orders-sec-to-turn-over-hinman-documents/) over their unsealing, as journalist Roslyn Layton filed an amended motion to petition the court for access to the speech, with US government watchdog Empower Oversight [supporting](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-court-case-update-as-of-february-24-2023/) the motion. Later on, in early March, Ripple [filed a letter](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-court-case-update-as-of-march-5-2023/) in line with the Supreme Court case that backed the [blockchain](https://finbold.com/topic/blockchain/) firm’s Fair Notice Defense as it ruled to constrain the US government’s power to impose penalties on American taxpayers who fail to disclose their offshore [bank](https://finbold.com/guides/banking/) accounts. Not long after, the first [major development](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-judge-rules-on-expert-testimony-motions-heres-who-benefits/) in the case saw Judge Analisa Torres issue a 57-page ruling in which both the blockchain company and the securities regulator sought to exclude expert testimony from summary judgment, although it did not seem to be a strong win for either side. Ripple’s win streak However, pro-Ripple lawyers later expressed their views that this decision could be [disastrous](https://finbold.com/ripple-scores-major-win-against-sec-with-fatal-exclusion-of-expert-testimony/) for the SEC’s summary judgment motion, particularly due to the exclusion of one specific witness, which Scott Chamberlain, a former attorney and co-founder of Evernode XRPL, referred to as “fatal to SEC.” That said, another [major victory](https://finbold.com/major-win-for-ripple-as-judge-denies-secs-motion-to-seal-hinman-documents/) for Ripple arrived in the form of Judge Torres denying the SEC’s motion to seal the controversial Hinman documents that refer to the speech by the former SEC division director in which he said that Bitcoin and Ethereum were not securities. As for the documents themselves, the public saw them on June 13, after which it [became clear](https://finbold.com/ripples-top-lawyer-decodes-hinman-files-what-went-on-behind-the-scenes/) that he had said that a crypto was not a security when it becomes “sufficiently decentralized,” despite senior SEC officials repeatedly warning him about the possibility of further confusing the [crypto market](https://finbold.com/category/cryptocurrency-news/). Finally, on [July 13](https://finbold.com/new-era-for-xrp-begins-as-ripple-wins-case-against-sec-ceo-reacts/), Ripple secured a legal triumph with Judge Torres’s summary ruling in which she ruled that the retail sales of XRP did not constitute securities sales. However, she did the court [did find](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-case-the-final-update/) that past direct [XRP sales](https://finbold.com/guide/buy-xrp-with-paypal/) to institutional clients do, in fact, constitute an [investment](https://finbold.com/guides/investing/) contract. What’s next As 2024 approaches, the only thing left for the case is the final settlement in which the presiding judge will decide how much money the blockchain company will have to pay in damages for the part of the court decision that referred to the institutional XRP sales. As it happens, Judge Torres [said](https://finbold.com/legal-expert-offers-timeline-for-ripple-v-sec-final-judgment/) in her pretrial scheduling order that the Court would seek to schedule a jury trial for the case in the second quarter of 2024, ordering both parties to submit blackout dates for trial by August 23, which would suggest late summer of 2024 as the period for the final settlement. What followed across August and September were [back-and-forth motions](https://finbold.com/ripple-files-opposition-to-secs-motion-for-early-appeal/) [regarding](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-case-update-as-of-august-18-2023/) the SEC’s [early appeal](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-case-update-as-of-august-21-2023/) to Judge Torres’s July ruling, culminating with her [rejection](https://finbold.com/judge-rejects-secs-interlocutory-appeal-request-v-ripple/) of the said interlocutory appeal despite the regulator’s incessant [attempts](https://finbold.com/ripple-v-sec-case-update-as-of-september-11-2023/) at adding more arguments for it. Finally, in late October, the SEC [agreed to dismiss the civil allegations](https://finbold.com/the-end-ripple-v-sec-final-court-case-update/) against the company’s CEO, Brad Garlinghouse, and co-founder Chris Larsen, in the third and final capitulation for the securities watchdog in its three-year crusade against Ripple. Meanwhile, XRP was at press time trading at the price of $0.63, down 1.01% on the day but growing its value by 1.6% in the last week and by 3.17% across the previous month while gaining as much as 83.29% over the year that is almost over, as per data on December 29. author: Lucía P Castillo
title: Presentan guante de alta tecnología que frena temblores en pacientes con Parkinson - UnoTV
text: La compañía GyroGear creó un guante de alta tecnología capaz de frenar los temblores causados por la enfermedad de Parkinson, el cual fue presentado en la [CES 2024 de Las Vegas.](https://www.unotv.com/ciencia-y-tecnologia/beauty-genius-loreal-presenta-su-asesor-de-belleza-con-ia-en-ces-2024/) Este guante es el estabilizador de manos más avanzado del mundo, según sus creadores. Y es que es además de ser capaz de detener los incontrolables temblores musculares que afectan a quienes padecen esta enfermedad, también permite a las personas realizar sus tareas cotidianas. La clave del dispositivo es un giroscopio con un disco en su interior que gira más rápido que la turbina de un motor a reacción, según su fundador, Faii Ong. De acuerdo con Ong, los guantes que frenan los temblores causados por el [Parkinson ](https://www.unotv.com/salud/parkinson-pesadillas-de-la-infancia-pueden-ser-una-senal/)se produce en la misma fábrica que los MacBook Pros, es decir en Foxconn, proveedor de Apple. GyroGlove con sede en Massachusetts, es una de las empresas presentes en la feria CES 2024, la gran feria tecnológica que cada año se celebra en Las Vegas, que trata de utilizar la tecnología para mejorar la vida de las personas con enfermedades o discapacidades. Motivo por el cual el guante que frena temblores producto del Parkinson fue presentada en el recinto que alberga la CES 2024 en Las Vegas.
